# transitionOptions

**Instance Property**

The animation options to use when switching between tabs.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var transitionOptions: NSViewController.TransitionOptions { get set }
```

## Discussion

By default, this property is set to the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSViewController/TransitionOptions/crossfade] and [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSViewController/TransitionOptions/allowUserInteraction] options.

The tab view controller uses the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSViewController/transition(from:to:options:completionHandler:)] method to perform transitions between tabs. For more information about how transitions happen, see the description of that method.

## Configuring the Tab View

- **tabStyle**: The style used to display the tabs.
- **tabView**: The tab view that manages the views of the interface.
- **canPropagateSelectedChildViewControllerTitle**: A Boolean value indicating whether the tab view controller gets its title from the selected child view controller.
